stories.title: Ask HN: How do you dispose of your dead (spinning platter) HDDs?
Meditation can help you make fewer mistakes

stories.text:
Not an iOS developer, but I’m not sure if this is a technical limitation imposed by Apple, or if there hasn’t been a better effort. Apple’s webview HIG docs say:

> Avoid using a web view to build a web browser. Using a web view to let people briefly access a website without leaving the context of your app is fine, but Safari is the primary way people browse the web on iOS. Attempting to replicate the functionality of Safari in your app is unnecessary and discouraged.

So I guess Appple didn’t really mean it when they started supporting a default browser on iOS.

All of the Extension talks only mention Safari, but maybe there is a way?

[0]: https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/ios/views/web-views/
stories.title: Ask HN: Can Safari extensions for iOS work in other browsers?

stories.title: Jack of all trades, master of none
The Exponential Age Will Transform Economics Forever (2021)

stories.text:
I am sure there is a clear security risks of using online tools like 1. JsonFormatter 2. YAML validator 3. SQL formatter 4. Image converter 5. PDF converter many more...

I am looking for real world examples/cases of security vulnerability/issues you/your company encountered. This helps me to make a case at my company to implement a company wide deployment of these tools(open source) as internal tools for developers to use.
stories.title: Ask HN: Risks of using online developer tools
